Method Detail

buildGISRoadNetwork

public static void buildGISRoadNetwork(repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<Road> roadGeography,
                                       repast.simphony.context.Context<Junction> junctionContext,
                                       repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<Junction> junctionGeography,
                                       repast.simphony.space.graph.Network<Junction> roadNetwork)
Create the road network. Runs through the roads in the roadGeography and, for each one, will create Junction objects at their end points and an edge linking them. The Junction objects are added to the given junctionGeography (so that we know where they are spatially) and they are also added, along with the edge between them, to the junctionNetwork so that topographical relationships can be established. (The junctionNetwork is part of the junctionContext

Parameters:
roadGeography -
junctionContext -
junctionGeography -
roadNetwork -

readShapefile

public static <T extends FixedGeography> void readShapefile(java.lang.Class<T> cl,
                                                            java.lang.String shapefileLocation,
                                                            repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<T> geog,
                                                            repast.simphony.context.Context<T> context)
                          throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                 java.io.FileNotFoundException
Nice generic function :-) that reads in objects from shapefiles.

The objects (agents) created must extend FixedGeography to guarantee that they will have a setCoords() method. This is necessary because, for simplicity, geographical objects which don't move store their coordinates alongside the projection which stores them as well. So the coordinates must be set manually by this function once the shapefile has been read and the objects have been given coordinates in their projection.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object to be read (e.g. PecsHouse). Must exted
Parameters:
cl - The class of the building being read (e.g. PecsHouse.class).
shapefileLocation - The location of the shapefile containing the objects.
geog - A geography to add the objects to.
context - A context to add the objects to.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the location of the shapefile cannot be converted into a URL
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the shapefile does not exist.
See Also:
FixedGeography

readAgentShapefile

public static <T> void readAgentShapefile(java.lang.Class<T> cl,
                                          java.lang.String shapefileLocation,
                                          repast.simphony.space.gis.Geography<T> geog,
                                          repast.simphony.context.Context<T> context)
                               throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                      java.io.FileNotFoundException
An alternative to readShapefile() that does not require objects to implement FixedGeography. Hence it can be used by objects that don't store their coordinates internally (such as agents).

Type Parameters:
T - The type of object to be read (e.g. PecsHouse). Must exted
Parameters:
cl - The class of the building being read (e.g. PecsHouse.class).
shapefileLocation - The location of the shapefile containing the objects.
geog - A geography to add the objects to.
context - A context to add the objects to.
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException - If the location of the shapefile cannot be converted into a URL
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the shapefile does not exist.
See Also:
FixedGeography
